subject: Parenting
title: Keeping Babies Up Later Makes Them Sleep Longer
description: A short lesson to help you apply Keeping Babies Up Later Makes Them Sleep Longer.

hook.text: A parent keeps her toddler up until 10 PM hoping for a long sleep-in. The child wakes at 5 AM anyway.

buildup.text: The logic seems bulletproof: more tired equals more sleep. But infant biology disagrees.

discovery.text: Overtired children produce cortisol, which makes it harder to fall asleep and stay asleep.

twist.text: Earlier bedtimes often result in longer, better sleep â€” the opposite of what parents expect.

climax.text: Sleep science calls it 'sleep begets sleep.' A well-rested child sleeps better, not less.

punchline.text: Tired children don't sleep more â€” they sleep worse.
